job-title: Software - Integration Engineering Internship (Spring 2021 and/or Summer 2021)
job-description:
Disclaimer: This position is expected to start either January/February 2021 or May/June 2021 and continue for a minimum of 12 weeks, up to a maximum of 12 months. Please consider availability before submitting an application.
Our Company
Tesla is accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy. We design, manufacture, sell and service the world’s best solar technology, energy storage systems, and electric vehicles, providing customers the opportunity to generate, store and consume energy entirely sustainably.
Tesla is committed to hiring and developing top talent from around the world for any given discipline. Based in California, Tesla’s workforce spans across four continents. We work to build an inclusive environment in which all people, regardless of gender, race, religion, or background, can come to do their best work.
Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional philosophy of interdisciplinary collaboration. Each member of the team is expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. We’re tackling the world’s most difficult and important problems—and we wouldn’t succeed without our shared passion for making the world a better place.
Internship Programs at Tesla
The Internship Programs Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by given them projects that are critical to their team’s success.
Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission.
Locations
Palo Alto, CA
About the Team

Tesla's Systems Integration Team is seeking an intern who will be responsible for ensuring firmware support for new vehicle features and new hardware are designed, implemented and tested to achieve Tesla’s standards for safety and customer experience.

The intern is expected to move projects along at an aggressive pace – keeping track of program milestones and deliverables and pulling together the contributions of many teams into a cohesive final product. Our intern is also expected to get their hands dirty in the details of their sub-systems – digging through source code, root causing issues and proposing solutions to complex problems, as well as testing prototype firmware implementations in-vehicle.

The Integration Engineering intern is at the center of the iterative firmware development process and has a broad range of responsibilities.

What to Expect
Bring-up and debug complex systems involving networked microprocessors and software-controller electrical and electrical-mechanical devices for Tesla’s prototype vehicles.
Understand and debug interfaces/interactions required for successful implementation of vehicle level firmware.
Support new firmware and hardware integration into Tesla’s prototype vehicles by carrying out functional verification of new components and/or features.
Work with the cross-discipline development and design engineers throughout the engineering organization to ensure the relevant subsystems are designed with appropriate requirements, interfaces and interactions to achieve specific vehicle functions.
Report and track issues with software and/or hardware releases.
Requirements
Currently working towards a BS, MS, or advanced degree in a relevant engineering program such as Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.
Experience scripting in Python, SQL, MATLAB, and writing software for electromechanical systems in C/C++.
Experience with electronic circuits and analysis, testing, and debugging microcontroller / embedded / electromechanical projects.
Hands-on technical experience debugging complex systems involving networked microprocessors, communication interfaces like CAN, and software-controlled electrical or electromechanical devices.
Understanding of hardware and software development processes.
Exceptional capacity for managing simultaneous activities and challenges.
Creative capacity for developing new ways to integrate complex system better and faster in alignment with the aggressive Tesla approach to revolutionary product development.
Eager to work in an aggressive start-up like company environment with great opportunities for growth and spectacular achievement

Data is deeply embedded in the product and engineering culture at Tesla. We rely on data –  lots of it – to improve autopilot, to optimize hardware designs, to proactively detect faults, and to optimize load on the electrical grid. We collect data from each of our cars, superchargers, and stationary batteries and use it to make these products better and our customers safer.

We're looking for a talented engineer to join us as a foundational member of the team to deliver new and improved big data services and infrastructure. Your work will affect many hundreds of Tesla engineers daily, as well as improving the functionality of our cars, chargers, and batteries worldwide.

Employ and improve industry-leading, scalable, distributed open-source technologies
Build back-end systems from scratch that are capable of handling trillion+ events per day

job-title: Senior Software Tools Engineer– Industrial Storage
job-description:
The Role 
The Tesla Energy Product and Service Engineering team is looking for an innovative, experienced, driven individual to develop software tools to support the explosive growth of our Industrial Storage fleet.  We are seeking a senior software developer to lead the creation of tools that will be used to interactively diagnosis why a system is not working as expected in the field.  These tools will be used by Tesla engineers and technicians working on our commercial and utility scale batteries deployed around the world to rapidly root cause a problem, identify the required fix, and verify the system is working properly after the fix has been applied.  You will work with a team of engineers to develop custom tools that will communicate with and control the power converters, digital control systems, heating and cooling systems in Tesla’s industrial batteries.  The software tool will decode and interact with CAN and Profinet data and will be capable of interaction with any individual ECU or group of ECU’s up to an entire battery block. You will be the primary developer of the software and will drive the software and firmware requests from related teams to facilitate the field team support software.   
  Responsibilities 
Lead the development of the field service software tool 
Directly interact with the field service team to identify detailed requirements for creating and improving the field service software tool 
Develop software that can directly interact with the Tesla industrial batteries, or any subcomponent of that system 
Work with the ECU programmer/owners for subcomponents of the Tesla industrial battery system to develop custom software to perform diagnostic procedures on individual – isolated – subcomponents of the system 
Write software to interact with custom rest apis, CAN bus data, Profinet and Modbus controls 
Create diagnostic interfaces that allow for the rapid, precise diagnosis of issues in complex systems and are a visual representation of the system being worked on 
Work with the firmware team to obtain dbc files and develop a system for automatically synchronizing dbc files and updated software to field tech computers 
Work with the security team for regular reviews of the field service software tool 
Develop a system for rollouts of updates to the software to a global team of technicians and engineers. 
Develop documentation and training for the field service techs using the tool you develop 
Must Have Requirements 
BS in electrical, computer, or software engineering with 4-8 years of experience or MS degree with 2-5 years of experience in power electronics, power converters, control systems, or embedded systems, or software to interact with and control custom hardware 
Proven cross-functional leadership and collaborative skills  
Strong engineering fundamentals and intuition, applied to power electronics or firmware/software-enabled mechatronic systems  
Relevant work experience – including significant first-hand experience with electronics design, electronics failure analysis, system test engineering, reliability engineering, or product engineering or user interface programming for custom electromechanical systems 
Excellent oral, written communication skills 
An ability to prioritize and execute many tasks in parallel.  Excellent attention to detail and an ability to produce clear and concise written documents and diagrams  
Nice to Have Requirements 
Experience using Python or equivalent for creating custom user interfaces 
Experience with battery systems and power systems  
Work travel is expected to be around 5% for this role.  This would include traveling to customer sites as well as our manufacturing and engineering facilities in the US.
